edu.cmu.sei.arche.ui.views
Class SwtTextWriter

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Writer
      edu.cmu.sei.arche.ui.views.SwtTextWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class SwtTextWriter
extends java.io.Writer
implements java.io.Serializable

A simple Writer, suitable for constructing a PrintWriter, which uses an SWT Text widget as its output. This class is a convenient way to write a GUI in which Jess prints its output to a text widget.

Author:
Paulo Merson (copied from jess.awt.TextAreaWriter)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
SwtTextWriter(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Text console)
          Call this with an already constructed Text widget, which you can put wherever you like.

Method Detail

clear

public void clear()

flush

public void flush()
Flushes pending output to the Text widget.

write

public void write(char[] b,
                  int off,
                  int len)
Writes a portion of an array of characters to the Text widget. No output is actually done until flush() is called.

Parameters:
b - The array of characters
off - The first character in the array to write
len - The number of characters form the array to write
See Also:
flush()
